docs.abstract: President Bartlet doesn’t live in the White House, even on TV, anymore. But his fans find solace in streaming an old favorite.
docs.snippet: President Bartlet doesn’t live in the White House, even on TV, anymore. But his fans find solace in streaming an old favorite.
docs.lead_paragraph: Election night, 2017. Alarmed and unnerved by the state of politics in America, Josh Reinitz, a lawyer and Democrat in Fair Lawn, N.J., is running for borough council. But it is a stressful time.

headline.main: They Can’t Get Enough of ‘The West Wing’ Right Now
headline.print_headline: Dismayed by Nation’s Politics, Some Tune In to ‘The West Wing’ Instead

docs.abstract: In the first nominating state, many Democrats feel a responsibility to identify a candidate who can win in states more diverse than their own.
docs.snippet: In the first nominating state, many Democrats feel a responsibility to identify a candidate who can win in states more diverse than their own.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Iowa — They share awkward glances at events where nearly everyone looks like them. They take comfort in reminding one another that they propelled Barack Obama to the White House. They swear that their values and priorities are representative of more than a Corn Belt farm state.

headline.main: Why White Iowans Want a Nominee Who Can Appeal to Nonwhite Voters
headline.print_headline: Why White Iowans Feel a Duty to Pick for All Americans

docs.abstract: Everything you need to know about the presidential primary debate lineup in Atlanta.

headline.main: November’s Democratic Debate: What to Watch For
headline.print_headline: What to Watch For In Tonight’s Debate

byline.original: By Reid J. Epstein and Shane Goldmacher

docs.abstract: Wine caves were all the rage, but they also symbolized a bigger fight among Democrats.
docs.snippet: Wine caves were all the rage, but they also symbolized a bigger fight among Democrats.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hi, and welcome to a special post-debate edition of On Politics. I’m Lisa Lerer, your host.

docs.abstract: It was the last question of the last debate of the year and Elizabeth Warren and Amy Klobuchar, who differ on many policy issues, were united in their answer.
docs.snippet: It was the last question of the last debate of the year and Elizabeth Warren and Amy Klobuchar, who differ on many policy issues, were united in their answer.
docs.lead_paragraph: It was the last question of the Democratic debate on Thursday, and the candidates were thrown a curveball. They could give a “gift” to someone else onstage. Or, in the “spirit of the season,” they could ask for forgiveness.

headline.main: The 2020 Democrats Were Told to Give a Gift or Ask Forgiveness. Guess What the Women Chose.

docs.abstract: Richard North Patterson wrote best-selling novels about presidents, until he decided that the political moment was too strange to make anything up.
docs.snippet: Richard North Patterson wrote best-selling novels about presidents, until he decided that the political moment was too strange to make anything up.
docs.lead_paragraph: WEST TISBURY, Mass. — Over four decades and nearly two dozen thrillers, the novelist Richard North Patterson has used current events as scaffolding for his imagination. Late-stage abortion, conflict in the Middle East, genocide in Africa, gun control, the death penalty — the thornier the issue, the better.

headline.main: How Trump Made a Writer of Thrillers Stick to Facts
headline.print_headline: A Best-Selling Author Of Political Fiction Shifts To a Quest for the Truth

docs.abstract: A letter from three former Fox News employees is designed to pressure presidential campaigns to do away with NDAs, calling them “a driving force in silencing workers.”
docs.snippet: A letter from three former Fox News employees is designed to pressure presidential campaigns to do away with NDAs, calling them “a driving force in silencing workers.”
docs.lead_paragraph: A new group founded by three former Fox News employees sent a letter to all presidential campaigns on Wednesday asking them to publicly condemn nondisclosure agreements that deal with workplace environment issues.

headline.main: 2020 Candidates Are Asked to Condemn Nondisclosure Agreements
headline.print_headline: Calling on Campaigns to Condemn Nondisclosure Deals

docs.abstract: Many questions remain about a potential Senate trial. Also, we preview Thursday’s Democratic debate.
docs.snippet: Many questions remain about a potential Senate trial. Also, we preview Thursday’s Democratic debate.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. I’m Lisa Lerer, your host.

headline.main: Here’s What We’re Watching After Impeachment

docs.abstract: Mr. Bloomberg’s proposal, which would offer a government alternative to private health insurance, is similar to plans from some of his more moderate rivals in the 2020 race.
docs.snippet: Mr. Bloomberg’s proposal, which would offer a government alternative to private health insurance, is similar to plans from some of his more moderate rivals in the 2020 race.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Former Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg of New York unveiled a health policy proposal on Thursday that would create a government-run health insurance plan but not provide universal guaranteed coverage, aligning himself with the more moderate wing of the Democratic Party in the 2020 presidential primary.

headline.main: Michael Bloomberg’s Health Care Plan: A ‘Public Option’ and Caps on Patient Fees
headline.print_headline: Bloomberg Calls for ‘Public Option’ and Capped Fees

docs.abstract: Fans of “Obi Bern Kenobi,” Andrew Yang and other campaigns make the most of a busy season of viewing options.
docs.snippet: Fans of “Obi Bern Kenobi,” Andrew Yang and other campaigns make the most of a busy season of viewing options.
docs.lead_paragraph: “Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker,” which opens this week, has a run time of 2 hours and 21 minutes.

headline.main: The Ultimate Jedi Mind Trick: Embracing 5 Hours of Debate and ‘Star Wars’
